Package com.example.binarybandits

Class QRCodeInfoActivityTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.binarybandits.QRCodeInfoActivityTest
  • public class QRCodeInfoActivityTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Assumptions: QR code SuperHilariousLeopard exists in the Firebase Database, worth 68 points. Link: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d0/QR_code_for_mobile_English_Wikipedia .svg/330px-QR_code_for_mobile_English_Wikipedia.svg.png (QR code from QR code Wikipedia page) Also assume person who is running the test has previously logged in on an account

    • Field Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void checkActivity()
      Assert we switch to QRCodeInfoActivity
      void checkBackButton()
      Check if back button works as intended (takes you back to profile page)
      void checkComments()
      Check if user can comment on their QR code and display comments
      void checkNoDelete()
      Check if delete button alert dialogue works.
      void checkNoGeolocation()
      Check that a click on the geolocation button gives an alert dialogue that no geolocation was found.
      void checkNoLocationImg()
      check if location image button displays a "no location image" alert dialogue if no location picture taken.
      void checkOtherPlayers()
      Check if see other players button takes you to the intended screen
      void checkQRName()
      Check if QR code name displayed is "SuperHilariousLeopard"
      void checkQRScore()
      Check if QR score displayed is "68"

      Runs before all tests and creates solo instance.

      • checkNoLocationImg

        public void checkNoLocationImg()
        check if location image button displays a "no location image" alert dialogue if no location picture taken. In this case: user robot never takes a location imagine so alert dialogue should come up

      • checkNoGeolocation

        public void checkNoGeolocation()
        Check that a click on the geolocation button gives an alert dialogue that no geolocation was found. Save any instance of coordinates, delete them to see if no geolocation message works, reapply the coordinates to the QR code
